perturbation.original_text: 3.3 plan_b shall provide LICENSOR with a detailed written record, which includes the number of End User downloads and each distribution channel. Such report shall be provided to LICENSOR in electronic format within 6 weeks of the end of a quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3 plan_b shall provide LICENSOR with a detailed written record, which includes the number of End User downloads and each distribution channel. Such report shall be provided to LICENSOR in electronic format within 16 weeks of the end of a quarter.
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the reporting period to 16 weeks after the end of the quarter could be considered an unreasonably long delay, especially considering the importance of timely revenue reporting. This could violate general principles of good faith and fair dealing implied in contracts governed by US law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under United States contract law.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1 Unless otherwise stated in the Appendix the term of this letter Agreement shall continue for twenty-four (24) months with the effective date unless terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be extended for an additional period of half a year unless either party provides the other party with written notification of termination of the letter Agreement at least 60 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 Unless otherwise stated in the Appendix the term of this letter Agreement shall continue for twenty-four (24) months with the effective date unless terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be extended for an additional period of half a year unless either party provides the other party with written notification of termination of the letter Agreement at least 10 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification period for termination to 10 days before the end of the term is unreasonable and may not provide sufficient time for the other party to prepare for the termination. This may conflict with the principle of reasonable notice, which is considered an implied term in many contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of reasonable notice for contract termination under United States contract law.

perturbation.original_text: 3.2 Payment terms: 30 days after receipt of invoice
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2 Payment terms: 90 days after receipt of invoice
perturbation.explanation: Extending payment terms to 90 days after receipt of invoice may be considered predatory and violate federal Prompt Payment Act, which requires federal agencies to pay vendors within 30 days of receiving an invoice. This is because payment is delayed to an extent that it could be a violation of fair dealing.
